NS1 protein, along with NS1, PB2, PB1, PA and PB1-F2 have been shown to be involved in the IFN-I response modulation27. the most prominent IFN-I antagonist in influenza virus is the NS1 protein which can suppress the IFN-I response by interacting with RIG-I. truncated PA-X was more effective in inhibiting IFN-I mRNA expression in PAMs and pigs through the shutoff activity of PA-X. truncated PA-X conferred increased viral pathogenicity, replication and transmissibility in pigs, promoted viral growth in PK15 cells and swine respiratory tissues infected ex vivo, and greater inhibition of host IFN-I expression. the 293T, MDCK, and PK15 cells were kept in our laboratory. the DMEM and RPMI 1640 media were supplemented with 10% fetal bovine serum (FBS, Gibco), 100 units/ml of penicillin, and 100 g/ml of streptomycin. all of the cells cultured at 37 °C in a 5% CO2 atmosphere. supernatants were sampled at 6, 12, 24, 36, 48, 60, and 72 hours post-inoculation (hpi) and titrated by inoculating MDCK cells in 96-well plates. all respiratory explants were cultured at an air-liquid interface in 12-well plates at 37 °C in 5% CO2 atmosphere. five uninfected pigs were maintained as a control group and were mock-inoculated with 2 ml PBS per nostril. three infected pigs from each group were removed to a separate room with three nave pigs at 2 days post-inoculation. clinical signs were observed by veterinary inspections at a fixed time daily throughout the duration of the study (14 days) the detection of swine influenza antigen in lung was executed through a ranked sore of 0–4. the indication of the scores was as follows: 0, no SIV-antigen-positive cells; 1, 1–10 positive cells; 2, 11–30 positive cells; 3, 31–100 positive cells; and 4, = or > 100 positive cells. 293T cells were transfected with 500 ng of empty vector or different PA-X proteins respectively. 200 ng of an IFN--promoter-luciferase reporter plasmid (pIFNbLuc) and 20 ng of a plasmid constitutively expressing Renilla luciferase (pRL-TK from Promega) were transfected. the animal use protocol was approved by the animal welfare committee of the CAU. the human embryonic kidney cell (293T), Madin Darby canine kidney cell (MDCK), porcine kidney cell (PK15) and porcine alveolar macrophages (PAMs) were kept in our laboratory. substitution from stop codon (UAG) to tryptophan (UGG) codon at position 42 in the X-ORF did not change the PA ORF (Fig. 2).
